newsitem.title: USA: CME pork belly futures close mostly limit up.
newsitem.headline: CME pork belly futures close mostly limit up.

text.p: CME pork belly futures remained strong on a reversal in August and technical demand in next year contracts and closed mostly up the 2.000-cent-a-lb limit. Hog futures also closed up on technical support, traders said.
August through March bellies finished limit up with August at 91.375 cents a lb and February at 84.150 cents. Other months finished 1.900 to 1.600 cents.
Recent selling pressure in August after three limit losses in a row, subsided as that month stopped following the fresh cash market and started looking at tight deliverable supplies.
"There are continued tight supplies and continued strong demand" for bacon, said Julia Bussie, analyst for AG Edwards.

Belly futures had fallen sharply recently when the fresh market broke from $106 per cwt to $81. Next year contracts started to show support Wednesday on an oversold condition and August turned Thursday morning after posting an early loss of 1.575 cents.

Bussie noted the strong technical signals continued in back months and a rally in August helped take those months up the daily limit. Deferreds held support Wednesday and appeared set to move higher, she said.
